summary: This is an FBI communication from Miami to Albuquerque regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution. It details the origins of the case from Palm Beach Police, evidence from search warrants, and plans for federal indictment. It notes the removal of computers from Epstein's home prior to the search and the recovery of incriminating message pads.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI investigation for child prostitution. A part-time resident of Palm Beach with multiple residences.

persons.name: SAJ
persons.context: An FBI agent in Miami, West Palm RA, to be contacted for investigative direction regarding leads.

connections.description: SA is the FBI agent investigating Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: FBI Investigation Initiated
events.description: The FBI Palm Beach County Resident Agency (PBCRA) began investigating Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: Search Warrant Executed
events.description: Palm Beach Police obtained and executed a search warrant at Epstein's home. Many belongings, including computer CPUs, were removed prior, but incriminating telephone message pads were recovered.

events.title: Planned Federal Indictment
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys and Case Agents set a target date for indictment, citing media coverage, vulnerability of victims, and political influences.

keyFacts: Computer CPUs were removed from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach home prior to the execution of a police search warrant and were never recovered.
Telephone message pads recovered during the search contained explicit messages like 'I have a female for him' and 'has girl for tonight,' linking girls to Epstein.
The FBI investigation aimed to establish Epstein's use of interstate commerce to engage in illicit sexual conduct and prostitution.
The document cites 'political influences' as a factor considered by prosecutors in setting a target indictment date of January 2007.
Epstein maintained residences in Palm Beach, the U.S. Virgin Islands, New York, and New Mexico at the time of the investigation.
